key_sections.section_title: Recognition of Cardiac Arrest and Initial Actions
key_sections.summary: Check responsiveness, breathing, and pulse. If no signs of life or abnormal breathing, call for help, start high-quality CPR, and attach defibrillator/monitor.
Deliver a shock as soon as possible for VF/pulseless VT, resume CPR immediately, give adrenaline after the second shock, and consider amiodarone after the third shock.
For PEA/asystole, focus on high-quality CPR, early adrenaline, and rapid search for reversible causes.
Systematic review of 4 Hs and 4 Ts (hypoxia, hypovolaemia, hypo/hyperkalaemia, hypothermia, tension pneumothorax, tamponade, toxins, thrombosis).
After ROSC, optimise oxygenation and ventilation, treat hypotension, consider targeted temperature management, and arrange appropriate critical care disposition.
